title: Brooklyn teen accidentally shoots himself while playing with loaded gun, family member arrested: police
content:
A 26-year-old Brooklyn man was arrested Saturday after he hid a gun a teenage family member used to accidentally shoot himself, officials said.
Kirk Paige, 26, is facing weapons possession, criminal tampering and disorderly conduct charges for stashing the .25-caliber Raven handgun used in the shooting on the roof of his Sterling Place Rehabs housing project apartment building on Sterling Place near Rochester Ave. in Crown Heights.
The 15-year-old boy was toying with the gun at about 4 a.m. when it went off inside his apartment, officials said. As Paige hid the gun, the teen was rushed to Kings County Hospital with a non-life-threatening wound.
The teen tried to cover for Paige, initially telling police that he was shot outside the apartment during a botched robbery, police said. But the boy's story fell apart when the gun was found.
Paige's arraignment was pending Saturday night.
It was not immediately revealed how Paige and the wounded teen were related.
